Docs.summary: Gets a substream of the specified message.
Docs.returns: The stream.
Docs.remarks: Fetches a substream of the message. If the starting offset is beyond the end of the message, an empty stream is returned. If the number of bytes desired extends beyond the end of the message, a truncated stream will be returned.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool SupportsModSeq { get; }
.property instance bool SupportsModSeq

Docs.summary: Gets whether or not the folder supports mod-sequences.
Docs.value: true if supports mod-sequences; otherwise, false.
Docs.remarks: If mod-sequences are not supported by the folder, then all of the APIs that take a modseq argument will throw and should not be used.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<MailKit.UniqueId> UidNext { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype MailKit.UniqueId> UidNext

Docs.summary: Gets the UID that the next message that is added to the folder will be assigned.
Docs.remarks: This value will only be set after the folder has been opened.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<MailKit.UniqueId> UidValidity { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype MailKit.UniqueId> UidValidity

Docs.summary: Gets the Unique ID validity.

remarks.para: UIDs are only valid so long as the UID validity value remains unchanged. If and when the folder's is changed, a client MUST discard its cache of UIDs along with any summary information that it may have and re-query the folder.
The will only be set after the folder has been opened.

MemberSignature.Value: public event EventHandler<EventArgs> UidValidityChanged;
.event class System.EventHandler`1<class System.EventArgs> UidValidityChanged

Docs.summary: Occurs when the UID validity changes.
Docs.remarks: Emitted when the UID validity changes.
